messages.content: What are the elements of a possible prompt for One Button Prompt when combining it with IMG2IMG functionality?

Elements of a possible prompt for OneButtonPrompt when combined with IMG2IMG would include type of image (e.g., portrait), the subject override (e.g., skull), and the selection of artists (e.g., all).
How can One Button Prompt be used when configuring ControlNET for TXT2IMG?

When configuring ControlNET for TXT2IMG, One Button Prompt can be used to set the subject type (e.g., object), select artists (e.g., all), and choose the type of image (e.g., all) for additional surprises.
How can One Button Prompt be used in an 'inpaint not masked' task?
For an 'inpaint not masked' task, One Button Prompt can be used to set the subject type (e.g., humanoid), select artists (e.g., for portraits), and choose the type of image (e.g., all).
What is the purpose of IMG2IMG functionality in the context of OneButtonPrompt?
IMG2IMG functionality is used to generate new images based on existing images, which can be combined with OneButtonPrompt to create interesting results.
What is ControlNET and how is it used with OneButtonPrompt?

ControlNET is a tool that can be used to control various aspects of image generation, such as depth, and can be configured to work with One Button Prompt to create specific types of images based on prompts.
How can the 'Inpaint not masked' feature be used effectively?

The 'Inpaint not masked' feature can be used effectively by selecting appropriate settings for padding, mask blur, and denoising strength, and using an appropriate inpainting model and One Button Prompt settings for the task.
What are One Button Presets in ComfyUI?
One Button Presets are saved generation settings that can be instantly loaded up. They make it easier to get good results out of One Button Prompt by providing a set of preconfigured settings.
How do I access all settings for One Button Presets in ComfyUI?
You can access all settings for One Button Presets by setting the One Button Preset to __"Custom..."__.
What is RuinedFooocus?
RuinedFooocus is a great Fooocus fork with One Button Prompt built in.
Where can I find One Button Prompt in RuinedFooocus?
You can find One Button Prompt under the One Button tab.
What does the Instant OPB button do in RuinedFooocus?
The Instant OPB button adds the prompt to the prompt field AND starts generating right away.
What does the Create Random Prompt button do in RuinedFooocus?
The Create Random Prompt button adds the prompt to the prompt field.
What does the Add To Prompt feature do in RuinedFooocus?
The Add To Prompt feature adds an additional prompt to the prompt field.
What is the use of the One Button Prompt style wildcards in RuinedFooocus?
The One Button Prompt style wildcards are used in conjunction with styles and are great for iterating through many images at once.
What is the use of the One Button Prompt artist wildcards in RuinedFooocus?
The One Button Prompt artist wildcards run the artist generation part of One Button Prompt.
What features are provided in One Button Run and Upscale?

One Button Run and Upscale allows users to generate an image with TXT2IMG, upscale the image with IMG2IMG, upscale the image with extras, and batch upscale existing images. It also features the Quality Gate functionality to ensure only the best quality images are upscaled.
What is the Quality Gate functionality of OneButtonPrompt?

The Quality Gate functionality of OneButtonPrompt enables users to set a quality score for images generated. It will repeat the image generation process and upscale only those images that reach the quality score. If no images reach the quality score, it will pick the image with the highest score after a specified amount of tries.
How does the OneButtonPrompt extension work?
OneButtonPrompt uses various calls to the WebUI API with the correct parameters in the correct order to work.
What is the URL used by default for the OneButtonPrompt?
The default URL used by OneButtonPrompt can be seen in your web browser and is typically 'http://127.0.0.1:7860'.
Where does OneButtonPrompt store the generated images?
OneButtonPrompt stores generated images in the 'automated_outputs' folder in your WebUI installation directory.
What is 'Don't generate, only upscale' mode?

'Don't generate, only upscale' mode allows users to skip the TXT2IMG part of the batch and upscale all image files placed in the OneButtonPrompt's '/upscale_me/' folder. This mode also reads the original prompt and negative prompt from the image file.
How can I use my own prompts with the OneButtonPrompt?

To use your own prompts with OneButtonPrompt, enable the 'Workflow mode' in the 'Workflow assist' tab and input your prompt into the 'Workflow prompt' field. For the negative prompt, use the 'Main' tab and put it into the 'Use this negative prompt' field.
What are the options for the 'chosen model' in the TXT2IMG settings?

In the TXT2IMG settings, the options for the 'chosen model' include 'Currently Selected Model,' which uses the model currently loaded, 'all,' which randomly selects a model, or a specific model can be chosen.
What is the purpose of One Button Presets in ComfyUI?
The purpose of One Button Presets is to showcase various tweaks and logic achievable with the settings, allowing users to explore different styles and achieve consistent results.
How do I save a new preset in ComfyUI?
To save a new preset, set the One Button Preset to __"Custom..."__, type the name you want to save as, and press 'Save as preset'.
How do I overwrite an existing preset in ComfyUI?
To overwrite an existing preset, type its name in the preset name field and press 'Save as preset'.
Where are presets stored in ComfyUI?
Presets are stored in the /userfiles/ folder in JSON format, named obp_presets.json.
